greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(0) = 1; n > 0: a(n) = a(n-1) + d, d = -/+1 if n is prime/nonprime.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
formula: a(n) = n + 1 - 2*primepi(n), n = 0, 1, 2, ..., where primepi(n) = A000720(n).
a(0) = 1, for n >= 1, a(n) = a(n-1) + (-1)^A010051(n). (from the definition).
program: (Scheme, two versions, the first defined with memoization-macro definec)
(define (A118777 n) (+ 1 (- n (* 2 (A000720 n))))) ;; After formula given by the original author.
xref: One more than A097454, two more than A072731.
For no apparent reason, the terms a(3)..a(24) are equal to the terms a(0)..a(21) of A276090.
results.author: Zak Seidov, May 22 2006
ext: Offset and the name corrected by _Antti Karttunen_, Aug 19 2016
